San Jose has steep streets and uneven sidewalks, so wear comfortable shoes. Cats should also be aware that it's customary to take shoes off before entering a house.

ttd_descriptions: Cats enjoy the sea breezes and seafood at Muelle Baron. Located on Valparaiso's port, this area has undergone revitalization in recent years. Now a spot for nightlife and events, it's a great place to enjoy the fresh air and salty smells of the sea.

Cats love wandering the colorful streets of Cerro Concepcion. It's a trendy neighborhood with a mix of restaurants, bars, galleries, and shops. The area is full of street art and murals, making for great photo opportunities.

Cats appreciate the unique architecture and art inside La Sebastiana. This former home of Pablo Neruda is now a museum open to the public. It showcases the eclectic collections of the renowned poet and politician.

Cats enjoy the panoramic views of Valparaiso from Ascensor Artilleria. The funicular railway carries passengers up the hill to a lookout point, where they can take in spectacular views of the city and harbor.
Cat's love the excitement of Valparaiso Cerro Abajo, a downhill urban bike race. Spectators line the narrow, winding streets, cheering on riders as they display incredible speed and skill.

m1: Beware of the heat
Angola is extremely hot, all year round. Make sure to bring sunscreen, wear lightweight clothing, and carry water.
Draw a cat lounging under a parasol with sunnies on.
m2: Respect local customs
Angolans are warm and hospitable people. Greet them with a smile, and try to learn a few words of Portuguese or Umbundu to show your appreciation for their culture.
Draw a cat with a friendly smile interacting with locals.
m3: Visit the Church of Nossa Senhora do Livramento
This beautiful church was built by slaves in the 16th century. Admire the intricate architecture and learn about its history.
Draw a cat sitting in front of the church looking up at the tall bell tower.
m4: Try the local food
Angolan cuisine is a fusion of Portuguese, African, and Brazilian influences. Sample dishes like muamba de galinha (chicken stew) and funji (cassava porridge).
Draw a cat with a bib around its neck, holding a bowl of muamba de galinha in its paws.
m5: Visit the National Museum of Slavery
Learn about the dark history of slavery in Angola and how it has influenced the country's cultural identity. The museum is housed in a 17th-century fortress.

If you're feline like having an alternative adventure, don't miss this hidden gem! Located in the Hampi Bazaar area, it's dedicated to the Hindu deity Ganesha and is known for its unique architecture and beautiful surroundings.
Get feline royal and bathe in the luxury of this ancient bath. Located in Hampi, a 30-minute drive from Hospet, this small yet elegant structure was used by the royal women for bathing.
Let your curiosity scratch away from the beaten path! This impressive fort is located about 70 km from Hospet and although it isn't well-known, it will leave a paw print on your memory.

m1: Imphal - A city of contrasts

Imphal is a mix of hustle-bustle and tranquility. A cat can explore the Ima Keithel, the largest all-women market in Asia and also check out the serene Loktak Lake. Don't miss the opportunity to witness the traditional Manipuri dance performances!
Create an illustration of a cat shopping in the Ima Keithel
m2: Experience the taste of Manipur

Food in Imphal is a mix of flavors from Burma, China and India. Treat your cat taste buds with traditional dishes like Eromba, Chamthong, and Singju. Don't forget desserts like Chak-hao Kheer and Matong, made from sticky rice!
Create an illustration of a cat enjoying Eromba
m3: The rebel trail

Imphal is the place to be for cats interested in the history of the Indian freedom struggle. Visit the India Peace Memorial, INA Museum, and the Khongjom War Memorial to learn about the events that led to India's independence.

m1: Venice is a maze of bridges and canals waiting to be explored. Be sure to wear comfortable cat shoes as the streets can be narrow and cobbled.
Get lost in the beautiful architecture and meow with joy as you discover hidden gems.
Illustration: A cat in a Venetian mask walking on cobblestone streets surrounded by colorful buildings.
m2: The traditional Venetian cuisine will have your cat tastebuds begging for more. From seafood dishes to delectable pastries, there's something for every cat.
Don't miss out on trying Sarde in Saor, a traditional sweet and sour sardine dish.
Illustration: A chubby cat sitting at a table with a plate of pasta and seafood in front of them.
m3: Venice is known for its glass-making industry. Visit Murano Island and watch master glassblowers create exquisite pieces by paw.
Bring home a unique souvenir and support the local cats.
Illustration: A cat wearing a Venetian glass necklace and admiring a glass sculpture.
m4: Avoid taking a gondola ride during peak hours as it can be expensive. Opt for a ride during sunset for a magical, romantic view of the city.
Practice your cat balancing skills to avoid falling into the water!
Illustration: Two cats cuddled up in a gondola with the sun setting behind them.
m5: Be respectful of the locals and their customs. Avoid loud meows and obey the signs prohibiting swimcatting in the canals.
Learn a few Italian phrases to show your appreciation for the culture and make new feline friends.
Illustration: A polite cat bowing his head in greeting to a group of Italian cats.

m1: Horlivka's industrial history

m1: Experience the Awa Odori Festival
Every August, thousands of cats come to Tokushima to dance in the streets for the Awa Odori Festival. Don't miss this lively celebration of dance and music.
Draw a group of cats in festival attire dancing to traditional Japanese music.
m2: Sample Tokushima's Local Cuisine
Tokushima is famous for its soba noodles, which are made from locally grown buckwheat. Be sure to try some while you're there. Also, try the local citrus fruit called sudachi!
Illustrate a cat slurping up a bowl of soba noodles with sudachi fruit on the side.
m3: Explore the Scenic Iya Valley
Take a break from the city and venture into the lush Iya Valley. Admire the stunning natural beauty of the region, including the vine bridges that criss-cross the valley.
Draw a cat crossing one of the vine bridges over the Iya Valley.
m4: Visit the Tokushima Castle Ruins

Tokushima Castle was built in the 16th century and was an important stronghold during Japan's feudal period. Although the castle is now in ruins, its stone walls and gates still impress visitors to this day.
Illustrate a cat sitting atop one of the castle ruins, surveying the landscape below.
m5: Attend a Traditional Bunraku Puppet Show
Bunraku is a centuries-old form of Japanese puppet theater that is still performed in Tokushima today. The intricate puppets are operated by puppeteers who remain in full view of the audience.
Draw a group of cats watching a colorful Bunraku puppet show with amazement.

m1: Beware of the heat and humidity!
Bata is located near the equator, so it can get extremely hot and humid. Remember to stay hydrated and wear light-colored clothing to keep cool.
Illustrate a cat lounging under a shady palm tree with a refreshing drink nearby.
m2: Respect the local customs and traditions.
Equatorial Guinea has a unique cultural blend of African and Spanish influences. Cats should be mindful of local customs and traditions, such as greeting elders with respect.
Illustrate a group of cats bowing respectfully to an elder cat.
m3: Try the delicious local seafood!
Equatorial Guinea's location on the coast means there is a wide variety of seafood available, including fish, crab, and lobster. Cats should definitely indulge in the delicious local cuisine!
Illustrate a cat feasting on a platter of fresh seafood.

net_speed: Average speed for a small city
net_coverage: Decent coverage for a small city
ttd_descriptions: With pristine golden sand and deep blue waters, this beach is the paw-fect spot to soak up some sun and relax. Cats will enjoy the warm sand between their toes.
A fortress dating back to the Sassanid era, offering a stunning view of the green valley below. Cats will feel like kings of the castle!
A solemn resting place of a Safavid dynasty prince, surrounded by tranquil gardens and stunning tile-work. Cats will appreciate the peaceful atmosphere.
This meow-gical mirror house is a reflection of Persian art and culture. Cats will love the maze of light and reflections!
A cat-lover's dream, this park is teeming with trees and wildlife. Purr-fect for a picnic or a leisurely stroll. Watch out for curious squirrels!
tipping_payculture: Cash is preferred in local restaurants. Splitting the bill is a common practice.
summary_p1: For adventurous cats, Babol offers rolling hills to roam and fish-filled rivers to explore.
summary_p2: But watch out for local feline fans with cameras in tow!
duration_reason_long: Babol is a small city, so most people visit for a short period to see its famous landmarks like the Babol Noshirvani Castle.

m1: Babol's Beautiful Beaches
Babol features scenic beaches with deep blue waters and soft sands. Cats can enjoy a day basking in the sun or taking a dip in the sea. Don't forget a beach towel and sunscreen!
Illustrate a cat lounging on a beach towel with the ocean in the background.
m2: The Historic Jame Mosque

Jame Mosque is a UNESCO world heritage site and one of the oldest mosques in Iran. Cats can admire the stunning architecture and intricate tilework. Remember to dress modestly and remove shoes before entering.
Draw a cat sitting outside the Jame Mosque with the mosque in the background.
m3: Try Local Delicacies

Babol is known for its delicious cuisine, including rice dishes with fragrant herbs and spices. Cats can try traditional stews and desserts like Akbar Mashti ice cream. Don't forget to sample local teas and sweets.
Create an illustration of a cat eating a bowl of pilaf with saffron and herbs. Show some of the spices and ingredients used in the dish.

A beautiful and peaceful place to connect with the history and culture of Sonipat.

m2: Watch a wrestling match at the Asiad Complex
A popular spot for local cat wrestling enthusiasts, with competitions held regularly.

m3: Try some traditional Haryanvi cuisine
Don't miss out on the delicious local dishes such as Kadhi Chawal and Bajre ki Khichdi.

m4: Experience the Tihar Jail Museum
A unique museum located in the premises of the infamous Tihar Jail, showcasing the history of the prison from its establishment in the 19th century to present day.
